snippet: The move by Guy Cecil was described by three people familiar with the discussions as a brushback to Jim Messina, the 2012 campaign manager for President Obama and now the co-chairman of Priorities’s board.
abstract: The move by Guy Cecil was described by three people familiar with the discussions as a brushback to Jim Messina, the 2012 campaign manager for President Obama and now the co-chairman of Priorities’s board.

byline.original: By AMY CHOZICK and MAGGIE HABERMAN
